body: During the summer of 2013 the Federal Reserve hinted that its quantitative easing purchases would be tapered. Treasury yields rose more than 120 basis points within three months and emerging market currencies sold off. Gold failed to act as a safe haven because the dollar strengthened and real yields turned positive. Spot prices fell from 1470 to the 1200 area despite geopolitical noise, highlighting that rising term premiums can pressure bullion even when growth anxiety appears.
